Dear Al:
We are beating the bushes ferociously to secure a
replacement of Jim Miles as Executive Director of the Na¬
tional Association of Educational Broadcasters. One of the
people whom we are considering at this point its Sail Adkins.
I. shall appreciate from you a confidential but detailed
evaluation of Gail and your estimate of his possible effec¬
tiveness on this job.
The Executive Director of HAEB must be a person
with real organizational ability, a man capable of holding
his own with national organizations and people in strategic
government and education circles: he must have imagination,
tact, and ambition and must be a real loader. In replacixg
Jim we hope to secure a man who will stay with us a minimum
of four years and this person must not only represent us
well with all groups on £ national level but must carry the
responsibility of welding and developing a strong national
organization of 1IAEB. We have been looking for a man in
the ten to twelve thousand dollar class but have not found
him. If we should employ some one on 0311*3 level, we would
expect to start him at seven or eight thousand dollars and
raise him on up as his growth merits.
Xou can understand that we should like to request
this information kept confidential and X assure you your
rdply will be treated with the same courtesy*
